alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 1:31PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Indian River, southwestern Brevard and east central Osceola Counties through 215 PM EST... At 130 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kenansville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Malabar, Camp Holly Fish Camp, Barefoot Bay, and Lake Marian. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Osceola
